place.name: HAREBY
place.gazetteerText: HAREBY, a parish in Spilsby district, Lincoln; 4 miles W of Spilsby r. station, and 6 ESE of Horncastle. Post-town, Spilsby. Acres, 750. Real property, £1,119. Pop., 93. Houses, 18. The manor belongs to Sir John W. Smith, Bart. The living is a rectory, annexed to the rectory of Bolingbroke, in the diocese of Lincoln. The church, excepting the chancel, was rebuilt in 1858. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
